headline: New Crypto Bill: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong Heads to Washington DC
summary: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong believes US crypto legislation finally has a shot at passing. After several days of meeting with lawmakers in Washington, Armstrong said the Digital Asset Market Clarity Act has “a good chance of getting done.” In recent years, Coinbase is where BlackRock stores its BTC while other ...

headline: Analysis-BlackRock, Vanguard scale back company talks as new guidance bites
summary: The world's two biggest asset managers sharply scaled back the number of meetings held with company bosses this year, disclosures show, as new guidance made it harder to discuss topics like climate change and diversity.  The shifts by BlackRock and Vanguard came in the wake of new guidance in February from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, led by a pick of U.S. President Donald Trump, Mark Uyeda, and could leave executives with less investor input on strategy or facing surprise critical votes at shareholder meetings.  The directives were among a series of recent Republican efforts to diminish corporate actions on everything from company climate disclosures to the role of proxy advisors.

The directives were among a series of recent Republican efforts to diminish corporate actions on everything from company climate disclosures to the role of proxy advisors.

headline: BlackRock Bullish on US Tech, Earnings, Brazier Says
summary: "We're pretty bullish about US tech, about US earnings and about the prospects near-term for US equities more broadly," BlackRock's Alex Brazier tells Bloomberg Television. He also discusses the "unreliable" correlation between stocks and bonds and why investors are seeking more liquid alternatives in their portfolios.

headline: Zijin Gold Seeks $3.2 Billion in World’s Biggest IPO Since May
summary: The gold producer is coming to market at a time when prices of the precious metal extend their rise — it broke another record this week.  Specifically, the value investors are paying for Zijin’s gold reserves is about 20% lower than the big global miners’ average, and 26% below a mid-sized miners’ average, Bloomberg Intelligence’s Michelle Leung said in a note.  Its parent, Zijin Mining Group Co., is one of the biggest gold producers around the world, with mines spanning from Central Asia to Africa and Latin America.
